title: Mount Manger
text: Mount Manger () is a snow-covered <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located northwest of <a href="Mount%20Josephine%20%28Antarctica%29">Mount Josephine</a> in the <a href="Alexandra%20Mountains">Alexandra Mountains</a>, on <a href="King%20Edward%20VII%20Peninsula">King Edward VII Peninsula</a>, Antarctica. The mountain was photographed from the air and roughly mapped by the <a href="Byrd%20Antarctic%20Expedition">Byrd Antarctic Expedition</a>, 1928–30, and was named by the <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> (at the suggestion of Rear Admiral <a href="Richard%20E.%20Byrd">Richard E. Byrd</a>) for William Manger, of the family that owned the <a href="Manger%20Hotels">Manger Hotel chain</a>, who assisted Byrd expeditions by providing free room for office space and for expedition personnel.
